alert.note: Alert for Oahu in Honolulu (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 22 at 5:12AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF OAHU IN HONOLULU COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Oahu in Honolulu County. * WHEN...Until 645 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. Rises in small streams, both on the windward and leeward side of the Koolau range. Dangerous driving conditions on the Pali and Likelike Highways, and on the H-3 freeway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 509 AM HST, radar indicated persistent moderate to heavy rain over the Koolau mountains. Occasional bursts of heavier showers are producing rainfall rates near 2 inches per hour. Be alert for elevated water levels in all streams emanating from the Koolau mountains, even in leeward areas where rain is not falling. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Honolulu, Waiahole, Kahaluu, Waikane, Ahuimanu, Aiea, Halawa, Pearl City, Kaaawa, Kaneohe, Moanalua, Salt Lake, Kalihi, Punaluu, Mililani, Maunawili, Wahiawa, Manoa and Kailua. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 645 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. Rainfall and runoff will also cause hazardous driving conditions due to ponding, reduced visibility and poor braking action.
